intro: Notelaea flavicans, commonly known as the yellow-flowered notelaea, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and leathery, evergreen leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland forest habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in dense inflorescences. Notelaea flavicans is valued for its ornamental qualities and plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
